Fields.DialogueText: Köln, what are you drawing on the floor of the deck? Some kind of modern art? I can already hear Heimlich shouting about "alberne instincts" in the back of my mind...
Don't worry. I am using Knigg, and a little scrubbing will wash it away again.
So, what's this all about? With the way you're boxing things, is this supposed to be for shuffleboard?
Werkeht. Rot wigger.
I can't say I know the answer. I'd maybe guess hopscotch, but I don't see why...
Tatsächlich, you got it!
I did? But what does that have to do with training? Unless it's some sort of exercise.
In a way. See the questions I wrote up on the Wand?
I see them, and I hope they can be erased as well.
Anyway, the different choices for the Froche correspond to different places on the Plan. I mapped out the best approach accordingly, so it's good practice.

Fields.MenuText: That's a pretty unique teaching method.
I don't know. It seems a little childish.
What made you combine the two different styles?

Fields.DialogueText: Danke! I want to find new ways to innovate and improve learning.
Villeich, ävver to be a Panz is to have the Potential and curiosity to learn and grow, so the comparison fits.
Mens sana in corpore sano! Both are essenziell for success in the world. So why not adopt a Strategie that develops both simultaneously?
Well, do you think I could give it a shot?
Go right ahead.
Let's see. Which country...
*SPLASH*
Spurt! What was that?
Och, nä! The Knig got smudged!
We can remake the board later. Right now, the perpetrators are closing in, so it's time to give them a wave of our own.
@BATTLE
Oh, yeah, I'm sure *that'll* appease him. "It's chalk, that's not frivolous at all!"
Bäh. Sarlasmus is boring, and unfitting of someone in command, Kapitän. Be positiv!
... You have Heimlich distracted somewhere else, then?
Jo. He's in his hidey-hole, writing more Maläste to his superiors.
Ah.
Hmm... How should I do this?
What are you working on?
I was trying to arrange all of my Bücher, ävver I am having trouble deciding where to place them on the Regale.
I see. You do have an awful lot of them.
I know. Some I liked a lot, and some I still need to read. Ävver I don't know which Sortierung would wörk the best. Any Ideen?
Well, for starters, I don't think you have enough room in here for all of them.
Allt en Ordnung. I was thinking that we could use larger Büchereiräume anyway. Do you think I could please refurbish the Messe?
Sorry. Find a plan B.
Any Vorschläge? For organizing the ones that will fit here, I mean.

Fields.MenuText: How about the UDC system?
Perhaps you can arrange them in the order you are going to read them.
Just try to place them together in a way that helps the books fit in nicely.

Fields.DialogueText: The UDC? ... Ah, Universelle Dezimalklassifikation! Jude Idee! It fits since I am collecting Bücher from around the world.
That might wörk, ävver I don't always know which one I'm going to read next.
Do häs do Rääch. The most important thing is to make sure that the Bücher stay in the best physical Kundizion, and the Arrangement is a key part of that process.
Well. Thank you for the advice.
Don't mention it. I'll leave you to your arrangement.
Sehr jud. And I'll let you know when I have a Plan in place for the Bücherei.
We'll see about that. See you later. Now, then, where...?
*THUD*
Köln, what happened?!
Argh! That Beben knocked a Regal down on me.
Are you okay?
I'm fine, ävver we need to leave the Bücher be for now. You know as well as I do what must have done this...
Yes, I do. Another day, another fight...
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
I know how you feel. Sometimes one just calls to you out of the blue.
Trying out a new instrument?
Ja! I learned that in Spanien they play a Tamburin in accompaniment to a Quetschbüggele.
Excellent. Got a fix on it yet?
Noch nit. It is a different Instrument than I am used to.
Well, learning these things takes... heads up.
... Listen, I make no promises, but it is remotely - remotely! - possible that I could help out on the tambourine once in a while, if it would make any kind of difference.
That could wörk. And if you also learned the Quetschbüggele, we could do it anders eröm!
That's... hypothetically true.
Ävver zuerst, we need to practice. Vun Nix kütt Nix.
We can discuss it further after we put out that ruckus these Morganas are storming up.
@BATTLE
Guten Morgen, Kapitän. I see we are not so worried about disturbing the Vögel now, Schiffsdame Köln.

Fields.MenuText: Not a lot of birds out here, luckily enough.
It's actually something of an experiment. Testing the auditory range of regional Morgana groups.
She may have changed her opinion on them after cleaning the deck.

Fields.DialogueText: Danken wir dem Himmel for small mercies.
... Ah. I would have appreciated to have been vorab informiert. If the Schiffsdame is actually following your Befehle, I might have to make one or two minor changes to my Rapport.
"Actually following?" When have I ever not?
As I say, *minor* changes.
I would have thought she would make an unterhaltsames little Spiel of the cleaning.
That's actually a jude Idee.
Nein. I was suggesting it as a... Symptom of your unseriöse Einstellung. It was not an Empfehlung!
That says more about you than it does about the Idee.
Unverschämtheit!
Kapitän, if you'll excuse me, I have Pflichten that require my Aufmerksamkeit.
Then by all means carry on with them, Hauptsturmführer Heimlich.
That's HauptSTU... ah. Danke, Kapitän.
... You called him by his proper Dienstgrad.
I'm lulling him into a false sense of security.
So, what's with the tambourine?
I'm trying to imagine how it would sound alongside my Wahlinstrument. I don't have much experience with it, obviously.
Uh-huh.
... Are you unwell?
For the record, telling her to make it a game-
Another Feind inbound! Let's give it our all!
@BATTLE
Do. Now try to stay quiet longer this time, verstanden?
Good job out there, Köln. You really cleared them away.
It's jud, Kapitän. The Jefech really was pretty easy once we got the hang of it.
You sound like you're disappointed about that. Are you still hoping for a bigger challenge?
Esu, it's not that I want us to be overwhelmed, ävver... I just get uneasy with our current Kundizion of affairs.
Danke, Kapitän.
You're welcome. Say, I think they're starting a party on deck. Want to come?
Nja secher!
I thought so.
That *ist* her Arbeit, Kapitän. Do you praise the Koch for not burning himself on the Ofen?
If the stove is on fire and trying to kill us all, yes.
Be careful what you say before the Mannschaft, Schiffsdame Köln. Their Moral is your responsibility.

Fields.MenuText: Everybody on this bridge knows what we're up against. We have a policy of honest discussion.
It's a fair point - and we still have work to do here. We'll talk later.
Köln? Care to reply?

Fields.DialogueText: Allt jud, Kapitän. I was only going to say that we need to wörk harder at Training. Become stronger, so we can face the Widrigkeiten ahead.
Du gibst also zu you haven't been training hart enough thus far.
Stop trying to pick a fight on my bridge, Hauptsturmführer.
Technically *my* Brücke. You just wörk here.
Of all the dumm-
Herr Heimlich, might I impose upon you to go see what's holding up my preliminary damage reports? I'd like to be sure the engines are sound before taking any further action.
Ah. Jawohl, Herr Kapitän!
Writing another letter, I see. Who's this one to?
The Universität zu Köln. I want to thank them for the Bücher they mailed me.
Yeah, that was really nice of them. I assume it was at some risk too - if Heimlich intercepted the shipment and saw anything he didn't like....
Indeed, and the Material was still quite interessant. I really enjoyed reading them.
That makes sense. Köln has a deep scholarly history, doesn't it?
Dot et. I just hoffe that that spirit of discovery endures in these Zigge.
Don't worry too much about it. Morganas have never gotten that far down the Rhine.
There is more in this war than just the Nixen, and the sides are not always clear.
Huh?
Nix. I don't like to discuss Politik, ävver if the Kreech heats up again, Köln could make for a strategic Ziel.

Fields.MenuText: To say nothing of the people.
Hey, some of the books will live on out here, right?
Hopefully we can find a way to end the war before it comes to that.

Fields.DialogueText: Do häs do Rääch; why didn't I think of it like that? Dat Hätz d'r Stadt is more than its Architektur...
Jo, this Scheff can serve as an Arche for Bücher in these troubled times.
Villeich. I would rather focus on educating Lück than getting involved in Politik.
Et es wie et es. At least I can keep the Nixen away from the Küsten through our wörk out here.
That's the spirit. And will you look at that? Here comes one now.
Akkurat pünktlich. Zigg to show them the might of swords and guns strengthened by the pen.
@BATTLE
Exactly. And one of its heirs is right in front of me.
If you want to bring about a better world, you might not have a choice in the matter.
Just don't overload us with too many books, okay?
Jo. There would have been quite the Stunk.
But they were careful, I take it.
... I don't know what to say. It could well be a target, one way or another.
I'm just worried about what will happen to its many Wunder.
Exactly. It's the people who call it home.
That is Köln's true legacy.
Back for another Schores?! Well, Kapitän, I suppose we can't turn them down!
@BATTLE
We... made it.
... Jo. That was tough, wasn't it?
So, Schiffsdame. Still excited about proving yourself?
Net janz... ävver I'm glad I held the line for you guys.
So am I. Listen, while we're not being monitored - you know you closed the distance with those things faster than we'd planned, right?
Esu... jo. Ävver we survived, and got stronger.
It won't matter if you end up dying. I know that you want to gain combat experience, but there's a reason we don't have you out there leading the charge.
Jo, I know. Ävver I was sure a Zerstörer had my range, and the best way to dodge seemed to be Beschleunigung.
... I have mixed feelings about that.
Oh, I'm not lebensmüde! I'm just saying, the worst thing I can imagine is if I survived, and those I cared about were gone.
Köln...
A Majistersch wants to see her Schüler grow, like a Moder wishes for her Pänz to live on. That means that I must letzten Endes be willing to offer myself first so they may levve.

Fields.MenuText: There's not a member of the crew that doubts it. Doesn't mean it's great for morale to hear you dwell on it.
We appreciate your determination to protect us, Köln. But you need to have faith that your pupils can stand on their own. We won't let you down.
Let's all get through this war alive, together. We're all here for each other, got that?

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't think about it that way. Et dot mir Leid.
You really have grown, Kapitän. Isch gläuve aan dich.
Jo, dat es wat m'r dun müsse. Hold together, and refuse to allow any of us to perish.
Anyways, just know that we're here for you.
Danke. I know you are.
Besides, at this point we're ready for anything they can throw at us.
It's okay. We all don't want to lose anyone.
And I should say... I don't care so much if I die, ävver I would never be careless with the Mannschaft.
Before you complain, Hauptsturmführer Heimlich, don't. It's appropriate to compliment the crew on what they've accomplished here.
Hmph. I'll go see to my Rapporte, then - with your Erlaubnis?
Granted.
Kapitän, luur!
At the whales? Magnificent, aren't they?
Moment ens! I'm going to take some Bilder of them while I have the Chance.
I didn't know you practiced photography.
Not that much, ävver once in a while I do. Dozo kütt, this will be useful for display later in a Museum.
In a museum?
I kind of dream of using my experiences out here to support a Marinemuseum in one of my hometowns.
That sounds like it would be really interesting.
Jo! The Ozean is so full of Geheimnisse to explore. That's what I love most about being out here.

Fields.MenuText: That makes sense. After all, life came from the sea initially.
I'll be interested to see the museum after the war is done.
I'm sure that the curators will put your donations to good use.

Fields.DialogueText: Evve. And so we all return to it, again and again.
I'm not sure if the Museen will be ready immediately, ävver I feel that they will become an important Teil of the communities in the Zokunf.
Danke. I'm doing my best out here to help gather knowledge for the next Generation.
Even so, there's nothing quite like the real experience.
Do häs do Rääch. We will have to do our best to protect the Ozeane as well.
Wait... Uh-oh.
Jo, dat sin kein Wale... Fortunately, my guns are loaded and ready for action.
@BATTLE
Herr Kapitän. Ah, Schiffsdame Köln. You have a new little pastime, I see. It must be so much more relaxing than that Training you were considering.
We were just discussing protecting the oceans. I wouldn't think that was controversial.
Verzeihung, Herr Kapitän, but I'm honestly surprised how an Offizier of your Qualität can fall into the habit of seeing this one's alberne little Ansprachen as proof of Determination.
Taten sind proof. Proof would be Training, Exzerzieren! Not standing here on the Reling waving a Kamera at the Horizont.
I was waving a Kamera at Wale. And you know the Trainingsplan as well as-
What are you fiddling with there, Köln?
Oh, I was just wörking on getting this Trikiti set up.
What's that? It looks like your usual accordion, but a little different.
It is a Variante local to Spanien. Remember how I said they use the Tamburin and Quetschbüggele together there?
I see. So this is the type of accordion they use.
Akkurat. Therefore, I thought that I should try one out.
How does it compare to your usual instrument?
It has the same overall Struktur, ävver a few different things here and there; it's tough getting used to it.
Ah, that's understandable, since you've just started out with it.
Still, it is somewhat deprimierend that my past experience with the Quetschbüggele is not enough to acclimate me to this new approach.

Fields.MenuText: Even so, "different" is not necessarily a bad thing, right?
Were you not the one who emphasized that we all need a challenge to grow stronger?
Don't give up. Show them the wisdom and strength that I know you have.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. It's actually a rather fun change of pace.
Jo, I was. Danke dir for reminding me. I should not be regretful, but rather elated at the need to improve.
Danke. I'll do my best.
Hey, I think I've got it!
Great! Though... if you're counting on me to show up with a tambourine, you should know I haven't had much time to practice.
You'll get the hang of it soon, I know it.
Thanks. With everyone helping each other learn more, we can get a lot done.
I know. And now it is time to apply that teamwörk to our Hauptfeind.
@BATTLE
While Herr Heimlich is sleeping.
Understood.
Köln? I think you left this book in the mess hall by mistake.
Ah, merci.
Mercy? Oh, I get it. So you know French as well? I knew that you were fluent in Polish and Spanish, but this is a surprise.
Oh, it's just a playful nod to my namesake's Zigg in the Regnum Francorum, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Ach du lieber Gott.
I... was not under the impression that the Franks spoke modern French.
Nein! Nein, they did *not*! Karl der Große spoke Ripuarisch, a good German Dialekt! This one-
I'm sorry to interrupt, but you've turned a genuinely unsettling color. I need you to stop and take a breath and calm down, or I may have to call for the doctor.
... Jawohl.
I didn't say that they spoke Französisch in Köln, anyway. I've just been reminded that we share a great deal of common history - I was the Hauptstadt of the Imperium Galliarum, you know.
And who knows who I would've been if the Vertrag von Verdun had been written just a little bit differently?
You should be more worried with who you are now.
Deep breaths, Herr Hauptsturmführer.
Ja, ja.

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, I would think a knowledge of European history would be a thing to encourage in the middle of a European war.

Fields.DialogueText: Deprimierend, when you put it like that... ävver wohr.

Fields.MenuText: Anyway, nothing wrong with knowing where you came from.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: And, Köln, let's try not to give our friend here a heart attack. His replacement could be even worse.

Fields.DialogueText: Dehr witzig, Herr Kapitän.
Claiming to be Französisch is just silly, though. She might as well say she's Italienisch because the Römer founded the Stadt.
Well, no, I would say the Ubii founded the Stadt. And they were Germanisch.
... Danke.
Ävver ego si vis Latine loquar.
Relax. Köln, I think I see somebody who needs to be tormented even more than our friend here.
Or, the colonia was.
Kapitän? While Heimlich is in absentia, I wanted to ask you about an Idee I have.
What is it? But make sure you cover us. These Morganas aren't out of the picture yet!
Jo, jo - I've got my eyes on them! Ävver anyway, I was thinking of expanding our Lehransatz out here, and seeing if we can apply it after the Kreech is over.
So you want to start up a training academy out here? That could work - but why are you asking me about it? I'm pretty sure you know more about teaching than I do.
Jo, ävver for what I have in mind, I think we'll need to get everyone involved. For the Blopause alone...
Blueprints? Is this some sort of remodeling plan for classrooms?
Kind of. It's tough to explain out here. I have a bunch of preliminary sketches, ävver I left them all in my Kajüte. Exküs.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I still don't know what you have in mind, but I promise that I will help you with it.
Don't worry, we can talk about this more later. From what you've already said, I'm intrigued to learn more.
Whatever it is, you must have put a lot of thought into it.

Fields.DialogueText: Really?
Do hääs Rääch; it's best that we concentrate on the Gefecht first. Ävver I'm glad that you want to hear more about the Idee.
Hann isch. I think that this will really make a difference in how we learn things, all around the Globus.
Danke for putting up with my Ideen in the middle of a Jefech like this.
Hey, it's not like you slack off at all while you make your plans. I know that I can always trust you to have my back.
Danke.
Anyway, let's wrap this up, and then we can sit down and talk more.
After the Seechesfeer, of course.
*ALARM*
I guess not. I suppose it's kind of customary for us by this point.
@BATTLE
Of course. What are friends for?
Danke for believing in me.
Okay, let's start at the beginning - what exactly is the project you want to work on?
Well, I got the Inspiration from our talks about Köln. I realized that even though Scholaren and Studenten can travel, the Universitäten themselves are bound to the Land.
Well, that's the way things are. Not much we can do about it.
That's what I thought, ävver then I remembered how I am a Repräsentant of Köln, yet one who can sail the world. So I want to take my Training duties to the next level.
You want to expand your capacity for helping soldiers with their exercises?
Well, not just Kommissköppe. What I mean is, even with my past Trainings, the Truppen were either Matrosen or stationed ashore. I want to change that, and make the Scheff itself a Schull.
Wait, I think I'm getting what you're suggesting. You want to establish a full-fledged school that operates from a vessel?
And not just one in Hafe, enä Käpitän! The Schüler would attend Kurse as the Scheff sails across the many seas, creating a truly internationales setting for study.
That's... an amazing idea. But will it work?
Et hätt noch immer jot jejange. That is why I need your Hilfe, and everyone else's. It will be a taxing endeavor, but I think that it is worth pursuing.

Fields.MenuText: Your blueprints are a little vague.
Do you think this sort of study will catch on?
Your idea is revolutionary, and it will change the world.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I was never the best Ingenieur. That is one of the areas where I need assistance.
I have confidence that it will räächziggich. With the increasing role of Scheffe from around the world cooperating out here, we are setting the stage for greater collaboration and exchanges.
I know. I may not be prepared to take a stand politically, ävver kulturelle aspects such as teaching can transform Levve in their own way.
Well, I'd be more than happy to help with trying to figure out how it might work, at least. Let's see if we can get the others on board with the idea.
Mer... probably won't get too far until the Nixen are defeated, though.
I'm afraid that was a given. Still, we can slowly make our way to the future we dream of.
@BATTLE
You might start by writing to Emden - if we can find a way to get the letter out unnoticed. I have the sense that she has similar interests.
You could have a whole academic flotilla one day.
Ah, damn. This storm is getting worse by the minute.
Ald dürch. We're almost through it.
That's a relief. Hopefully we can have some time to rest before the next battle.
I wouldn't be so sure - luur na vöre.
Huh? Some low-hanging clouds or waves? No, wait. Not now.
Jo. We are not the only Scheffe in this Sturm, and these ones are likely not friendlies.
No, they're Morganas by the looks of it. At least the weather will impair them as well.
Wie schad. It would have been a good challenge for us.
Enough. This fight will still be difficult in our current circumstances. But I guess we don't have a choice.
Do hääs Rääch. What do you wish for us to do, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Hold the line, and stay strong.
Coordinate with the other ships to make a close formation. In this weather, we'll have to stay together.
Set up some mines. With the rain to cover us, the Morganas will hopefully miss what we're up to.

Fields.DialogueText: Kein Sorg. Even if I were to sink under the Well, I would continue to ballern until they were all sunk.
Jo, it is best for us to stick together under these Kundizione. It offers a good opportunity to test our teamwörk.
Verstonn. Not the most exciting wörk, ävver it gets the wörk done.
They're almost here. Ready, Köln?
Don't worry about me. Et hätt noch immer jot jejange.
I hope so, but this fleet looks fearsome.
Just think about this as a Lihr zom... you know... liere.
I'll settle for just surviving. In any case, it's time. Charge!
@BATTLE
Machen Sie keine Witze!
I'm not joking!
Then übertreibst you a good Idee exzessiv, which is just another kind of Dummheit!
Hmm...
You look kind of stuck on something. What seems to be the trouble for you?
Oh, it's just a little Dilemma I have on my Museumsgaben.
What's the issue? Not finding enough material to donate?
Dat nit. I just don't know which Stadt I should donate my Material to...
Oh, I see. You have three different hometowns you could support.
I know, and I like all of them. What should I do?

Fields.MenuText: How about Wilhelmshaven?
Kiel could work.
Köln most certainly.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, the natural environments along the Küste there would be perfect for a Museum specializing in Meereslevvewesen.
Our naval experiences out here would wörk well for a Marinemuseum by the Docks there.
Köln? I have to admit, it almost feels like Nepotismus. Then again, it would fit well with my Lihrambitionen.
Danke for the Hilfe, ävver I think I will actually divide my support between the Städte.
That makes sense. Sorry that I couldn't be of more help.
Don't be! You helped me realize that each Stadt has its own Qualitäten, so I can help each one out differently.
That's right. We all bring our own skills to the table.
And we certainly need it out here- the Nixen will crush us if we do not learn to bring out the best of our Vermöge.
@BATTLE
Yet another Krawallo inbound! Let's give it our all!
@BATTLE
That's that. Now that we're finished, do you want to discuss our teaching approach more?
That can wait. For the moment, let's fiere!
... You know Heimlich's not here, right? He banged his arm in the fight and he's getting it checked out.
You're not saying I should postpone the Feer until he's back, are you? I don't think he'd approve.
It doesn't! It's just... always been a little jarring to see how you can jump from being very studious - or very intense in battle - to bouncing off to drink and dance.
I don't understand. What's so confusing about that?
They just seem like two entirely different approaches to life.
Unsinn. Learning is all about having Feez and enjoying et Levve. Same with a Feer.
That kind of makes sense.
See? It's all connected.

Fields.MenuText: I guess you're right. Sorry for not understanding.
I still think that it's kind of unusual, but that's part of what makes you so interesting.
On the other hand, teachers usually try to keep parties and school separate.

Fields.DialogueText: Allt jood. After all, you were able to learn something, right?
Akkurat. If we were all easy to understand, there wouldn't be anything neat to liere.
That's their Philosophie. Mine is to live and let learn.
Now, enough talking. We have a Fier to jump into.
Right behind you. Let's get started!
That's the spirit! Let's learn how to get jeck and laugh!
Yep, you are always a teacher at heart.
I know. I *do* feel bad for him. It's my Arbeid to protect him, after all, and...
No, it's just... I guess I've been thinking that part of the reason for your dramatic shifts to "party mode" has been a desire to needle the man.
Nä. You know I like Fiere! Why does it have to be more than that?
And they both bring Lück together to share their experiences - surviving a Jefech just makes the need for it more akut.
Okay, I think that the first big issue to tackle with regards to the ship academy project is the matter of housing.
Hm. I thought you would say that.
I can understand why you want a mobile school, but the students need to have a place to stay. Not to mention other resources.
We do just fine out here...
We're sailors, so we're used to it. The plan wouldn't be as bad if the school functioned as a naval center, but if we're going for overall schooling, it's a whole different story.
Then the Antwood is that we include those necessary features on Bord.
Köln, at the scale you've specified on the blueprints, we're not talking about including just a full school anymore. This would take an entire city.
I know, ävver isn't there some way we can get this to wörk?

Fields.MenuText: We could make the facilities a little more compact than the land-bound ones.
Perhaps if we distributed the school across multiple ships, things would even out.
I guess we'll need an entire new breed of ship for the job.

Fields.DialogueText: Jude Idee. After all, how hard can it be? We got the Garten to wörk.
That would be really interessant. Especially when we can have individual Scheffe come and go between different Flottenschulle.
Then we had best get to wörk in designing it.
Well, we're past the first Phas of Design... sort of.
Which is jud, since I think we'll have to delay on further planning for the Moment.
More Morganas?
Jo, more Nixen. There's a Chance there are some heavy hitters, I'm afraid.
So it's the perfekte way to get some training in!
@BATTLE
There's a big gap between a little garden and a full park. Still, let's see what we can do.
Maybe this wasn't the best idea.
... I'd be fascinated to learn if you and Emden have ever compared teaching styles.
Honestly, it's the most boring part of her Breefe.
Jude Dach, Kapitän!
Oh, hey there, Köln. Nice day, isn't... okay, what have you got there and are you going to try to get me to wear it?
Oh, nein. This is all for me! I've taken advantage of our new international connections to get my hands on a "Davis Lung."
... Or is it "David's?" No, "Davis."
I've heard of these things. They're for escaping damaged submarines, right? Some kind of breathing apparatus?
Präzise. And I thought, why not see if I can use it while exploring the Meer recreationally?
That's not what it's meant for.
It's not like you to be so kleinkareet!
No, I mean, it's not designed for comfort or anything. Is it?
And do you even technically need to breathe?
I'm not sure, to be honest. I like breathing, though. I would prefer not to stop.
Herr Kapitän. Schiffsdame Köln. May I ask what you've found to do statt zu arbeiten today?

Fields.MenuText: She's proposing to test British closed-circuit breathing apparatus. Some fascinating potential military applications.
She appears to be in the middle of a conversation with her commanding officer.
I believe the lady is planning to examine oceanic conditions up-close.

Fields.DialogueText: Papperlapapp. There are Taucher better suited for this Arbeit.
And wasting both their Zeit, zweifellos.
How? By jumping in? Do you think this is a Strand, Schiffsdame Köln? Ein Sommerurlaub?
None that are guaranteed to survive in the event the gear fails.
I can't believe the SS just löhnt for you to stand around being ruppig.
She's taken fire in the last twenty-four hours. I don't think she thinks it's a holiday.
Let me remind you both that my Funktion aboard this Schiff ist beobachten of the Walküre's behavior and I korrigier it when it reflects poorly on her superiors and on the Reich itself.
I think we can all be einig that I've shown considerable Zurückhaltung so far - and I fear the Konsequenz is that the... the Frivolität aboard this Schiff has only increased!

The Walküre is the Walküre. She protects the Mannschaft. She inspires the Mannschaft. Every time she flounces around the Deck like a Kind mit einem neuen Spielzeug, she makes her tasks that much harder!
I wasn't flouncing. I was standing kusch, talking to the Kapitän.
I'd argue that your very public efforts to denigrate her, and to suggest that I permit a sufficient lack of discipline to endanger my crew are a greater concern.
Herr Kapitän, ich würde niemals! Your Siege speak for themselves.
They're her victories, too.
Ja, ja. It's when she's not fighting that she's a Problem.
Oh, well. I'm afraid the Problem is about to be solved.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, I need help figuring out another part of my Plan for the Schull.
What are you stuck on?
It's about the Kurse. I'm just having a bit of trouble figuring out which kinds to include.
What seems to be the main issue? You specialize in teaching, so I'd think that this would be one of the easier things for you.
@BATTLE
Ävver I'm interested in everything! When Heimlich called me "a Panz net enem neuen Spielzeug" the other day he wasn't entirely wrong.

Fields.MenuText: So the problem is that you need a curriculum that will continue to hold your interest as you teach it?
So you want some kind of outside body to help you prioritize topics for instruction?
Do we need to talk about Heimlich?

Fields.DialogueText: I hadn't thought of it in those terms. Ävver there is some truth to it, I suppose.
Yeah, you're one of my dearest friends, and I say this with love, but I can easily imagine you requisitioning new sets of textbooks every other week. Rough on lesson plans.
... Villeich.
You know who would volunteer.
Heimlich.
Heimlich. Or, worse, somebody back in Berlin.
He's like schläch Wedder, Kapitän. The only thing to discuss is how best to chart a Kurs past him.
Ävver juxich!
Heh.
Listen, I have a mental exercise for you.
Interessant! Go on!
I want you imagine the kind of student you most want to reach, and then I want you to make a list of what you think he or she most needs to know.
Start with a clear sense of what you actually want to do, and then maybe the rest will become clearer.
You disagree?
Nä, nä. I sense Nixen incoming. Ävver you've given me an interesting challenge, Kapitän!
Let's start with the more urgent challenge first, okay?
He was wrong that getting excited by new discoveries is a fault, ävver...
Kapitän, do you know any Bröckeexperte on Bord?
... I'm afraid not, but you could check with the rest of the fleet.
Got it. Trotzdem danke.
You're welcome... But why are you asking about bridges?
I just wanted to have one built onto the Scheff. A large one, I mean.
... Of course you did.
I thought it would make things easier when we need to move between Scheffe.

Actually, I believe there are some plans under discussion. There may well come a day when we want to send significant boarding parties to certain Morganas, and efficient connection would be essential.
Jo, and it could come in handy once the Schullscheff gets underway.
Anyway. You want to test it out on yourself first, I assume?
Right. I was thinking of a Schwenkbröck. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: First we need to find someone with the right know-how.
Why a swing bridge in particular?
I don't see how anything structurally significant wouldn't unbalance us. And it would get in the way in combat.

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I'm up to right now. Hoffentlich I can find someone.
There's a very nice Bröck of that sort in Wilhelmshaven. I always liked the Ästhetik.
I didn't think of that. Exküs.
If you can work out schematics for something that wouldn't just tip us over, I can run them by some engineers. For feedback, if nothing else.
Danke!
Still, you do realize that even if we made it work, the Morganas would probably send the whole bridge falling down on a weekly if not daily basis.
Juder Punk. And here come some more of them now!
@BATTLE
Don't worry - if push comes to shove, we can always research it ourselves.
It's okay. It did sound like an interesting concept to explore.
"Bridge experts." You mean, your bridge? Is there a structural problem I need to worry about?
Nä, nä! The kind you walk over.
Then you would probably not want the ones designed to sink spikes into the deck of the partner ship.
Een corvus novus? Only if she was into that kind of thing!
... I'm so glad Heimlich isn't here.
Fischen once again, I see.
It is an enjoyable little Ziggvertreib. And permitted under INPF Richtlinien!
Nä. I think that the Feschgründe are not as large as they used to be.
Think it's because of the Morganas?
Partially, ävver it may be from overfishing as well. Such a shame. The Meere should be bustling with Levve...
I guess that it's something we'll need to address after we're done with the Morganas.
Or even before then. Sometimes I wonder if the Nixen are a reaction to the mess we have made in the Gewässer.

Fields.MenuText: You think they're some kind of punishment?
Even if they aren't, they're certainly making the problem worse.
Then we really need to take steps to recover the oceans.

Fields.DialogueText: Or simply a result of our mistakes. I cannot forgive the Nixen, ävver I wonder if we share part of the Schold for what has happened.
That is true, all right. We are going to need to address the full enormity of the Krise sooner rather than later.
My thoughts präzisselich. Hopefully by finding unity out hier, we can wörk to enact globale policies accordingly.
... I'm afraid that's something for later, Kapitän. I'm afraid I've found us a big fish after all.
@BATTLE
Care to join us?
I'm afraid I have a busy schedule, Herr Kapitän. I admit, I'm überrascht you have the time.
My schedule's on hold until we make some kind of contact with a reported local Morgana group. Köln can sense them more clearly when she's close to the water, so...
Ah. Natürlich. One might wish her Fähigkeiten were more dependable-
Hey!
Aber man muss nehmen, was man hat. With your Erlaubnis, I will leave you to it.
Permission granted.
I can think of ways *hä* might be improved by getting closer to the Wasser. Or in it.
I'm just glad you two are getting along better.
Dun mer nit!
You're more willing to push back against him, and he's hardly even trying to get you reassigned as a training ship anymore.
Hmph.
Getting any bites?
Hang in there, Köln. We can't lose you.
Don't worry; I've got this. För d'r Kaiser!
Köln, mess with Heimlich's head on your own time!
Dä, that should do it! They're not anjezählt yet, ävver we've got a little breather at least.
Okay, now go back to what you said before.
Oh. I was just thinking about Kaiser Wilhelm, and it... sort of slipped out.
Du dummes Gör! You think, what, that he should return from Doorn? Take back his Krone?
Nä! Nein, not at all! It was a Jux!
Köln...

Fields.MenuText: There's a time and a place for political humor, and on the bridge at the start of a battle aren't them.
*sigh*
Hauptsturmführer Heimlich... are we going to have a problem?

Fields.DialogueText: I have made a Schwur, Kapitän. No one could seriously believe that I would want to return to a System that failed.
Wat? Kapitän, you're taking this too seriously.
Wie bitte? Kapitän, you're taking this too ernst.
... This has to be reported.
I'll owe you a favor if it's not.
Bestechung, Herr Kapitän?
A favor.
Wie bitte?!
@BATTLE
You've been here for months now. You know she doesn't deserve the hassle that-
But she doesn't learn any other way!
Maybe I don't want to learn what you-
Silence.
... I will write my Rapport. You may be permitted to see it before it's sent, Herr Kapitän. Mehr kann ich nicht tun.
Mol luure.. Together with Königsberg and Karlsruhe, we can cover Germany, ävver where else...?
So. What's with the list there?
I was making a Liste of all our origins.
You mean for the ships?
Jo. And I am including Nationen where we have additional experience, such as myself with Spanien and Polen.
Interesting. But what for? Record keeping?
Actually, this jehört to the Schullplan. I want the Schull to travel the world, and likewise I wish for it to symbolize the world.
And you want the Belles to start looking for potential students.
Well, just Föhler at this stage. We still need to get started on the Schull. With some luck we can gather enough Lück once the Kreech is over.
Are you sure all of the governments will agree, though?
Well, given that I'm currently inhaftiert for something nümmes could possibly have taken seriously, I'm not optimistisch.

Fields.MenuText: Everyone will come together in the end. We just have to do our part.
Well, the school will definitely be interesting. I'd like to see it when classes start.
Then again, given everything we're doing out here, maybe our outreach will have some success.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja. We just need to take a stand.
Danke. I hope I can live to see it as well.
That's what I'm hoping. Given the Reputaziones of the Scheffe as heroes in our homelands, we might have some extra sway in getting Schüler abroad.
Well, I'll let you get back to your tally.
Just a Moment, Kapitän. Think you could write some Breefe?
I'll see what I can do.
Danke.
Just as long as no Morganas are invited... not that they would ever listen.
Oh, they're quite welcome to attend. It gives us more opportunity for Zielübungen.
@BATTLE
How are you holding up?
Oh, allt jood. I love being confined to my Kajüte.
The INPF only works because everybody agrees that Belles aren't going to be a security problem for their parent nations, you dummy.
If I don't punish you, somebody worse will. They may anyway.
It was just a doofe Jux!
Yep.
Fein im anmaasch! Let's give it our all!
@BATTLE
I hope you don't mind missing the post-battle celebration, Herr Hauptsturmführer.
Kapitän?
I would have thought she would be back in her Stube by now.
Just enjoying the Ussich a little.
She's out here because I asked her to be. I don't think we have a big problem yet, but I want it to stay that way.
If the Schiffsdame can sich benehmen in a manner befitting her Position, there will be no Probleme. I admit, I have my Zweifel.
Hauptsturmführer Heimlich... I'm not apologizing to you, ävver there's something I feel I should make clear.
What I enjoy most im Levve is exploring, and sharing what I have learned with others. I don't want Uffstäne. I don't want Chaos.
I'm too alt and the Mannschaft is too jung, Herr Kapitän. I prefer my Ausschweifungen at a distance.
I am not a politische Walküre. I have never had any desire to be. Whatever you think of me, you have to know that.
I don't presume to change what happens on Land, because I will *niemals* understand it well enough to be sure of what's right. It's a world I'll ever know through other Lücks Auchge.
My Jux about the old Regime was provokativ. And it was aimed at you, and I do apologize for *that*. Ävver you lived through some of those Zigge, and I... wanted to know how you would react.
What it meant to you. How I can learn from it. How I can help the younger Mannschafts members learn from it.
... I can't help you. I have no thoughts about the Vergangenheit - only the Zukunft. And your Art will always bring Chaos wherever you go.
Kapitän. Are we done here?

Fields.MenuText: Huh.
I suppose we are.
Köln? Anything to add?

Fields.DialogueText: Okay. Thank you for your time.
Sehr gut.
Have I upset you? It honestly wasn't expré.
You're a dummes Gör who says dumme Dinge. Why would I be upset? Your Art will get what it deserves in jedem Fall.
... Am I in even more trouble than I was?
I don't know.
If I am, next time I'll just start with the Quetschbüggele.
Please don't.
More blueprints, I see. Trying to move ahead with the school ship project?
I was thinking of installing a Tramsystem an Bord.
A tram system? On a boat?
Well, I think it would serve as a nice alternative Transport possibility.
Would there be enough room here?
Nä, ävver I was thinking that we could link it between some of the vessels.
And tangle them all up in the process.
En Ordnung, perhaps not that, ävver it would make for a good addition to the Scheff we use for the Schull.

Fields.MenuText: But then the students wouldn't have the opportunity to get exercise through walks.
Why trams specifically?
If you think it can work, you can give it a shot.

Fields.DialogueText: Something I acutely miss. Do häs Rääch, of course.
They have them back zohus. I thought it would be nice to see persönlich how they wörked.
Danke, ävver I'm having second thoughts.
Maybe this wasn't such a jude Idee.
Well, we're still at the planning stage. Some ups and downs are to be expected.
Do häs met Rääch. I just have to keep thinking on it.
Ävver right now we have other things to think about.
@BATTLE
It's besser than worrying about whether I somehow hurt Heimlich's Jeföhle.
Really?
I'm trapped in my Kajüte. My mind goes to strange Orte.
Okay, so... what have we got here?
Herr Kapitän!
Am I intruding?
On your own Schiff? Niemals!

Fields.MenuText: If I weren't the captain, would I be intruding?
Well said.
Careful. The power will go to my head.

Fields.DialogueText: Nein! Not at all! I was just watching the Horizont for the Feind!
Danke.
Herr Kapitän...?
*sigh*
I can't help but notice you haven't shared your report on our Belle's outburst.
I haven't arrived at a final Version yet.
You know what she's doing while she's locked in her quarters?
Something albernes, wehrkraftzersetzendes, no doubt.
She's designing a tram system that would extend off her deck and deliver students to and from other ships in her university fleet.
... Schwachsinn.
I actually checked the layout after I talked to her. I don't know if she realizes it, but I'm pretty sure she's drawing a scale representation of the tram routes in the city she's named after.
Which she loves with a passion that I'm not sure you and I can ever really understand. I don't know if "valkyrie" is the right word for what she is, but you have to know she's as German as the soil.
She's not disloyal to the nation. I don't think she can be.
You can be loyal and still lead the Volk astray, Herr Kapitän. Badly astray.
True.

Fields.MenuText: But she wins a lot of fights.
You think that's what she's doing?
Some might say she's not Germany's greatest threat in that regard.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Ja. I can't deny it.
I think she's a albernes Mädchen, and I think that's unlikely to change.
But she's my Aufgabe.
I suppose I could guten Gewissens submit a Rapport that says only that she has demonstrated a Sinn für Humor inappropriate to combat Situationen. Would you be prepared to cosign?
In this case, yes. But not behind her back.
... Im Gegenzug, I believe you offered a Gefallen?
I did.
Can you load that verdammte Akkordion into a Kanone and shoot it at the next Nixe we fight?
Sure. But she'll just get a new one.
*sigh*
@BATTLE
Enjoying the festivities, Köln? Glad to be done with house arrest?
Drop kannse Jeff nimme! Ävver.. Do you think we could go to the side and talk for a bit?
Sure. You've read Heimlich's report?
Which *you* signed!
Which I co-wrote, actually.
... I thought I recognized the drüge wit.

Fields.MenuText: You're being too kind.
You mad?
It was the best deal you were going to get.

Fields.DialogueText: Wohr.
I'm not wödig. None of what you both wrote was wrong, and surprisingly little of it feels unjerecht.
Particularly compared to the fate of your accordion.
Too. Soon.
Sorry.
Allt jud. Some Zigg back, you challenged me to imagine my Idealschüler. Someone I wanted to help better themselves. And suddenly it's hit me.

Fields.MenuText: Yourself?
It's not me, is it?
... Okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Nein. I already love learning! I'm just fine!
You may be beyond hope.
Hey!
Heimlich!
Not a good idea.
Ävver et es! Kapitän, is there anyone on this Scheff who needs to discover the Reiz of the wider world more than that Kääl?
Köln. He's an SS officer. And he's not a young man. And he has really undue influence on your career. You need to be very careful with-
I will be! Because my best Kabänes will be watching over me when I'm at risk of going too far!
But-
Because my best Frünnd has to pay me back for ming Sachschade!
Köln...
Hear me out! It'll be so juxisch!
